intro: Drosanthemum overbergense, commonly known as the Overberg daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in arid regions.
